instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this lineâ€™s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Keeps blowing ISL causing short on SCL data line
threads.message: Something is happening with this board where it keeps blowing <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> with the only resulting damage being a short on <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL</SIGNAL>. When I replace it, the computer will charge normally and work on battery and then after about a day it will blow again. This has happened with different genuine batteries and different genuine power adapters. We've cycled through the problem many times thinking it was the battery, and then no, it was the adapter, and on and on. It will happen with any battery or power adapter. Was liquid-damaged originally. Any idea what might be causing something like this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Keeps blowing ISL causing short on SCL data line
threads.message: Crap under battery connector causing high voltage on data line. Worst case would be a problem inside the board.
